intro: Chamaecrista ursina, commonly known as wild indigo, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in wetland environments. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Chamaecrista ursina is also valued for its historical use in traditional medicine.
